Indian Oil Corporation Ltd. has overtaken Oil and Natural Gas Corporation Ltd. to become India’s most profitable state-owned company. ONGC was for long India’s most profitable company but lost the crown to private sector companies Reliance Industries Ltd. and Tata Consultancy Services Ltd. a couple of years ago. It has now been unseated as the most profitable PSU by IOC. Is this just a headline, or is there more to this story? We decided to run through the numbers to establish the trendlines that have brought the two companies to this point.First, let’s compare ONGC’s profitability trend with that of IOC. The chart below tells the whole story.
















Profitability has multiplied at IOC whereas ONGC’s numbers have dwindled over the years. The reasons could be multi-fold, including business cycles turning unfavourable for ONGC, and deregulation being a huge tailwind for the oil marketing companies. But are there any reasons, specific to ONGC, for why it has suffered the fate that it has?
title: Why IOC Pipped ONGC As The Most Profitable PSU
